bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to William W. Caswell, Jr., December 22, 1952

div1.p: Hench is sending Caswell two photographs of the Camp Lazear dedication taken with his own camera. Hench will make any desired prints for Caswell once he gets the film from Nogueira.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to William W. Caswell, Jr., December 22, 1952
div1.opener:
Hench secty
no. reg corresp.
personal corresp
December 22, 1952
Mr. William W. Caswell, Jr.
First National Bank of Boston
Havana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Caswell:
div1.p:
Again, a thousand thanks for your wonderful help which
I shall acknowledge shortly.

Enclosed are two snaps taken with my own camera,
but Doctor Nogueira gave me before leaving Cuba,
a fine set of prints of the whole ceremony, photo-
graphs taken by various photographers. He promised
to send me on loan the films, last week. They
haven't arrived, possibly because he was making
prints for you and others who participated. But
when he does send them I will see to it that you
get what copies you wish, certainly those of you
participating in the ceremony: there are two or
three - one of you leaning over facing the
wreath and at least one large one of you standing
by the wreath after placing it. I shall shortly
send copies of these to Doctor Berry.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosures
